qas.question: What is to the south of the Sahara?
What kind of climate does the Sahel have?
What is the long term precipitation average of the Sahara?
What type of Savanah is north and south of the Sahara
What drought tolerant plant grows south of the Sahara?
What type of grass grows on the northern Shara?
How much rain does the Sahara get?
What is to the north of the Sahara?
What is the Cenchrus biflorus a member of?
What is the short term southern limit of the Sahara's precipitation?

plausible_answers.text: Sahel, a belt of dry tropical savanna

qas.question: What extends across Africa from north to south?
What type of grass is atypical to the Sahel?

context: To the south, the Sahara is bounded by the <a0_0><b7_0><b10_0>Sahel<b7_0/><a0_0/>, a belt of <a1_0><b3_0>dry tropical<b3_0/><a1_0/> savanna<b10_0/> with a summer rainy season that extends across Africa from east to west. The southern limit of the Sahara is indicated botanically by the southern limit of <b4_0>Cornulaca monacantha<b4_0/> (a drought-tolerant member of the <b8_0>Chenopodiaceae<b8_0/>), or northern limit of <b5_0><b11_0>Cenchrus biflorus<b11_0/><b5_0/>, a grass typical of the Sahel. According to climatic criteria, the southern limit of the Sahara corresponds to the <a2_0><b6_0><b9_0>150 mm<b6_0/><a2_0/> (5.9 in) isohyet<b9_0/> of annual precipitation (this is a long-term average, since precipitation varies annually).
